alert.note: Alert for Marshall (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 25 at 3:28PM EDT until June 25 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 PM EDT FOR NORTHERN KOSCIUSKO AND SOUTHEASTERN MARSHALL COUNTIES... At 328 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Bourbon, or 10 miles south of Nappanee, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. This severe storm will be near... Winona Lake and Milford around 345 PM EDT. Warsaw around 350 PM EDT. North Webster and Pierceton around 355 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Etna Green, Big Barbee Lake, Little Chapman Lake, Oswego, Ridinger Lake, Monoquet, Hoffman Lake, Leesburg, Inwood and Atwood. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for north central and northeastern Indiana. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
